hero.title: Don't ask the AI.
hero.subtitle: Ask collective knowledge.
hero.description: Here a collective knowledge archive is being created – carried by real voices, texts, and experiences. Choose a library, explore open content, and begin your conversation.

libraryGrid.title: Choose your knowledge library
libraryGrid.description: Each library bundles freely available knowledge from talks, studies, or projects. You can search through them – or query them like a conversation partner and bring in your own perspective.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.subtitle: A simple process that makes real knowledge accessible

step1.title: Choose a library
step1.description: Pick a topic area that matters to you and dive into the content.
step1.detail: All content comes from open, verifiable sources.

step2.title: Ask your question
step2.description: Enter what you want to know – in your own words.
step2.detail: The platform understands your context and adapts the narrative style accordingly.

step3.title: Discover perspectives
step3.description: Have answers told to you from different viewpoints:

howItWorks.subtext: Knowledge is not invented. It is recombined from real contributions – traceable and transparent.

philosophy.title: Transparency instead of black box
philosophy.subtitle: Every answer is based on people who share their experiences. The underlying content always remains visible and verifiable. This creates a knowledge space that is open, trustworthy, and maintained by the community.

transparent.title: Verifiable
transparent.description: All sources are transparently linked and verifiable.

human.title: Human
human.description: The foundation is real voices, not artificial opinions.

trustworthy.title: Trustworthy
trustworthy.description: The libraries are curated by research, communities, and NGOs.

behindLibraries.title: Who stands behind the libraries?
behindLibraries.description: These libraries are created in collaboration with universities, research groups, NGOs, and open communities. They contribute their content, values, and perspectives – so that knowledge does not serve individual actors, but benefits everyone.

cta.title: A shared adventure project
cta.description1: Knowledge Scout is not a finished product, but an open laboratory – an adventure project in development.
cta.description2: We experiment with open technologies to find out how collective knowledge will be experienced in the future: through listening, reading, understanding, and shared reflection.
cta.description3: If this interests you, you are invited to think along, test, or contribute libraries yourself.

aiGenerated.contentAutoGenerated: This content was automatically formulated with AI.
aiGenerated.contentGenerated: ⚠️ This content was formulated with AI.

gallery.storyModeTooltip: In Story Mode, you can have the contents explained to you in your language, your interest profile, and your context.

storyMode.headline: Story Mode – Have the contents explained to you from your perspective
storyMode.subtitle: Experience shared knowledge together
storyMode.description: This overview shows you the most important questions and topics from the talks you selected. You can specify what interests you bring and from which context you view the contents. This way, answers are aligned to the aspects that are particularly relevant to you. Ask your own questions or follow the suggested topics – according to your approach.
storyMode.reloadTooltip: Overview no longer current, please recalculate

perspective.title: Your Perspective
perspective.adjustPerspectiveDescription: Specify how the contents are prepared for you: in which language, with which interest profile, and from which context. This way you get answers that reflect your approach and priorities.

gallery.referencesDescription: The answer was generated from these documents.
gallery.otherDocuments: Other documents that also deal with this question
gallery.translationGenerating: Translations may take a moment, please be patient.

session.headline: Discover the contents of this event
session.subtitle: Shared knowledge from open talks
session.description: Get an overview of all available talks. You can filter by topics or years and explore the contents that interest you. If you want, you can later switch to Story Mode and have the topics told to you from your perspective.
session.filterDescription: Select topics to find the talks that are relevant to you.

book.headline: Discover the contents of this collection
book.subtitle: Explore shared knowledge together
book.description: Browse the available documents and filter by topics or authors. If you want, you can later switch to Story Mode and have the contents explained and summarized for you – adapted to your context.
book.filterDescription: Select topics or authors to find the contents that suit you.

characterTooltips.undefined: No specific perspective is weighted. Answers will be formulated neutrally.
characterTooltips.technical: Focus on functionality, systems, technology, and methods.
characterTooltips.social-cultural: Focus on people, culture, community, and social dynamics.
characterTooltips.ecology: Focus on nature, long-term impacts, and sustainable development.
characterTooltips.business: Focus on processes, organization, collaboration, and models.
characterTooltips.educational: Focus on teaching, learning, and understandable didactics.
characterTooltips.practical: Focus on everyday application, practical relevance, and concrete examples.
characterTooltips.research: Focus on analysis, methods, evidence, and critical thinking.
characterTooltips.creative: Focus on visions, ideas, experiments, and new perspectives.

accessPerspectiveTooltips.undefined: No specific access perspective is weighted. Answers will be formulated neutrally.
accessPerspectiveTooltips.insight: Emphasizes understanding, connections, reflection, and deeper insights.
accessPerspectiveTooltips.community: Emphasizes collaboration, participation, social impact, and togetherness.
accessPerspectiveTooltips.sustainability: Emphasizes ecological, social, and long-term responsibility.
accessPerspectiveTooltips.learning: Emphasizes clear, illustrative communication and learning-oriented approach.
accessPerspectiveTooltips.practical_view: Emphasizes implementability, practical relevance, and concrete application.
accessPerspectiveTooltips.future_view: Emphasizes potential, innovation, possibilities, and future visions.

socialContextTooltips.undefined: No specific language style is specified. Answers will be formulated in a neutral style.
socialContextTooltips.scientific: Technical, precise style with clear terms and structure.
socialContextTooltips.youth: Relaxed, vivid style with youth-oriented examples.
socialContextTooltips.senior: Calm, readable style with clear step sequence.
socialContextTooltips.professional: Structured, factual style for professional contexts.
socialContextTooltips.children: Very simple language with vivid examples.
socialContextTooltips.easy_language: Short sentences, simple words, clearly and barrier-free explained.

perspectivePage.title: How should answers be formulated for you?
perspectivePage.subtitle: So that content is presented in the way that is most understandable for you.
perspectivePage.whyThisPageText: Each person brings a different approach. Your selection ensures that answers match your background and interests.
perspectivePage.languageSectionHelp: In which language would you like to read the answers?
perspectivePage.characterSectionHelp: Which topics are in the foreground for you? The answers weight these areas more strongly.
perspectivePage.accessPerspectiveSectionHelp: Which type of access fits you best? The answers highlight matching aspects more strongly.
perspectivePage.socialContextSectionNote: You determine only the style – not the content. The answers are based on the same sources.
perspectivePage.saveButtonFooter: You can change your selection anytime later in Story Mode.
